00005 #include <fstream>
00006 
00007 #include "NonmemTranslator.h"
00008 #include "SpkCompilerException.h"

00010 using namespace std;
00011 using namespace xercesc;
00012 //=========================================================================================
00013 //
00014 // Generate Pred.h, a file declaring and defining Pred template class.
00015 //
00016 // Pre-conditions  - The symbol table contains the NONMEM keywords and user defined variable
00017 //                   names needed by the user-provided model.
00018 //
00019 //                 - The symbol table contains entries for the data labels and aliases.
00020 //                   The data labels have to be retrievable by calling 
00021 //                   SymbolTable::getlabels().  
00022 //          
00023 //                 - The vector returned by SymbolTable::getLables() must contain
00024 //                   the data labels in the order in which they define the data items 
00025 //                   (ie. columns) in the data set.
00026 //
00027 //                 - The current working directory is writable.
00028 //
00029 // Post-conditions - Pred.h is saved in the current working directory.
00030 //
00031 //=========================================================================================
00032 void NonmemTranslator::generatePred( const char* fPredEqn_cpp ) const
00033 {
00034   //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00035   //
00036   // Preliminaries
00037   //
00038   //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00039 
00040   const vector<string> * const labels = table->getLabels();
00041   const int nLabels = labels->size();
00042   vector<string>::const_iterator pLabel;
00043 
00044   // 
00045   // A SymbolTable object uses a std::map object as the actual
00046   // table.  The usual way of retrieving the entries in the internal
00047   // table is though member functions provided by SymbolTable class.
00048   // Another way, which is used here, is to access the internal
00049   // table directly, which is faster and convenient.
00050   //
00051   const map<const string, Symbol> * const t = table->getTable();
00052   map<const string, Symbol>::const_iterator pT;
00053 
00054   //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00055   //
00056   // Write into Pred.h
00057   //
00058   //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00059 
00060   //
00061   // Declare and define Pred template class.
00062   // For name binding reason, the declaration and the definition
00063   // are both stored in a single file: Pred.h
00064   // 
00065   ofstream oPred_h( fPred_h );
00066   if( !oPred_h.good() )
00067     {
00068       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00069       snprintf( mess, 
00070         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00071         "Failed to create %s file.", fPred_h );
00072       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_STD_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00073       throw e;
00074     }
00075 
00076   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00077   //
00078   // Print out some description for this file.
00079   //
00080   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00081   oPred_h << "// " << myDescription << endl;
00082 
00083   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00084   // 
00085   // Header include statements.
00086   //
00087   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00088   oPred_h << "#ifndef PRED_H" << endl;
00089   oPred_h << "#define PRED_H" << endl;
00090   oPred_h << endl;
00091 
00092   oPred_h << "#include <vector>" << endl;
00093   oPred_h << "#include <string>" << endl;
00094   oPred_h << "#include <spkpred/PredBase.h>" << endl;
00095   oPred_h << "#include <CppAD/CppAD.h>" << endl;
00096   oPred_h << "#include \"DataSet.h\"" << endl;
00097   oPred_h << endl;
00098   
00099   
00100   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00101   //
00102   // Declaration of Pred class
00103   //
00104   // The template argument (ie. "ValueType" in this case)
00105   // must be something guaranteed that the user
00106   // do not use for one of their user-defined variables.
00107   //
00108   // The specification for SpkSourceML where the 
00109   // definition of PRED or other models appears
00110   // restricts user use of variable names beginning
00111   // with "spk_", let's take advantage of it here.
00112   //
00113   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00114   oPred_h << "template <class spk_ValueType>" << endl;
00115   oPred_h << "class Pred : public PredBase<spk_ValueType>" << endl;
00116   oPred_h << "{" << endl;
00117       
00118   //----------------------------------------
00119   // Public member declarations.
00120   //----------------------------------------
00121   oPred_h << "public:" << endl;
00122 
00123   // -----------
00124   // Constructor
00125   // -----------
00126   // This constructor takes a pointer to the DataSet (the set of
00127   // all individuals' data).
00128   //
00129   oPred_h << "   Pred( const DataSet<spk_ValueType>* dataIn );" << endl;
00130 
00131   // ----------
00132   // Destructor
00133   // ----------
00134   oPred_h << "   ~Pred();" << endl;
00135

00137   // Public member functions
00138   // -----------------------
00139   oPred_h << "   int getNObservs( int ) const;" << endl;
00140   oPred_h << "   int getNRecords( int ) const;" << endl;
00141   oPred_h << "   int getMeasurementIndex( int ) const;" << endl;
00142   oPred_h << "   int getMeasurementIndex( int, int ) const;" << endl;
00143   oPred_h << "   int getRecordIndex( int ) const;" << endl;
00144   oPred_h << "   int getRecordIndex( int, int ) const;" << endl;
00145   oPred_h << "   bool eval( int  spk_thetaOffset, int spk_thetaLen," << endl;
00146   oPred_h << "              int  spk_etaOffset,   int spk_etaLen," << endl;
00147   oPred_h << "              int  spk_epsOffset,   int spk_epsLen," << endl;
00148   oPred_h << "              int  spk_fOffset,     int spk_fLen,"   << endl;
00149   oPred_h << "              int  spk_yOffset,     int spk_yLen,"   << endl;
00150   oPred_h << "              int  spk_i," << endl;
00151   oPred_h << "              int  spk_j," << endl;
00152   oPred_h << "              int &spk_m," << endl;
00153   oPred_h << "              const std::vector<spk_ValueType>& spk_indepVar," << endl;
00154   oPred_h << "              std::vector<spk_ValueType>& spk_depVar );" << endl;
00155   oPred_h << endl;
00156   oPred_h << "   bool eval( int  spk_thetaOffset, int spk_thetaLen," << endl;
00157   oPred_h << "              int  spk_etaOffset,   int spk_etaLen," << endl;
00158   oPred_h << "              int  spk_epsOffset,   int spk_epsLen," << endl;
00159   oPred_h << "              int  spk_fOffset,     int spk_fLen," << endl;
00160   oPred_h << "              int  spk_yOffset,     int spk_yLen," << endl;
00161   oPred_h << "              int  spk_i," << endl;
00162   oPred_h << "              int  spk_j," << endl;
00163   oPred_h << "              const std::vector<spk_ValueType>& spk_indepVar," << endl;
00164   oPred_h << "              std::vector<spk_ValueType>& spk_depVar );" << endl;
00165   oPred_h << endl;
00166 
00167   //----------------------------------------
00168   // Protected member declarations.
00169   //----------------------------------------
00170   oPred_h << "protected:" << endl;
00171   oPred_h << "   Pred();" << endl;
00172   oPred_h << "   Pred( const Pred& );" << endl;
00173   oPred_h << "   Pred & operator=( const Pred& );" << endl;
00174 
00175   //----------------------------------------
00176   // Private member declarations.
00177   //----------------------------------------
00178   oPred_h << "private:" << endl;
00179   oPred_h << "   const int                     spk_nIndividuals;" << endl;
00180   oPred_h << "   const DataSet<spk_ValueType> *spk_perm;" << endl;
00181   oPred_h << "   DataSet<spk_ValueType>        spk_temp;" << endl;
00182   oPred_h << "   bool                          spk_isIterCompleted;" << endl;
00183   oPred_h << endl;
00184 
00185   // Taking care of the data items (from the data file).
00186   // Only the "ID" data item values are of type string,
00187   // otherwise all numeric, spk_ValueType.
00188   pLabel = labels->begin();
00189   for( int i=0; i<nLabels, pLabel != labels->end(); i++, pLabel++ )
00190     {
00191       bool isID = ( *pLabel == nonmem::ID );
00192 
00193       const Symbol* s = table->find( *pLabel );
00194       oPred_h << ( isID? "std::string" : "spk_ValueType" );
00195       oPred_h << " " << s->name << ";" << endl;
00196       if( !s->synonym.empty() )
00197     {
00198       oPred_h << ( isID? "std::string" : "spk_ValueType" );
00199       oPred_h << " " << s->synonym << ";" << endl;
00200     }
00201     }
00202 
00203   // Taking care of the user defined scalar variables.
00204   // The entries in the symbol table include everything,
00205   // the NONMEM required items such as THETA and EPS
00206   // and the data item labels as well as the user defined
00207   // scalar variable names.  The data item variables
00208   // are taken care in the previous step, so now
00209   // just pull out the user defined scalar variables.
00210   // The NONMEM variables are given to
00211   // Pred::eval() every time the iteration advances.
00212   for( pT = t->begin(); pT != t->end(); pT++ )
00213     {
00214       const string    varName         = pT->second.name;
00215       enum Symbol::Ownership  owner   = pT->second.owner;
00216       enum Symbol::ObjectType objType = pT->second.object_type;
00217 
00218       if( objType == Symbol::VECTOR )
00219     {
00220       if( varName == nonmem::THETA || varName == nonmem::ETA || varName == nonmem::EPS )
00221         {
00222           // These are independent variables for the user's model.  So, want to keep
00223           // them around along with the computed values.
00224           oPred_h << "typename std::vector<spk_ValueType>::const_iterator " << varName << ";" << endl;
00225           continue;
00226         }
00227       else if( owner == Symbol::USER )
00228         {
00229           // There should be no vectors except the ones above.
00230           char m[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00231           snprintf( m, 
00232             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00233             "%s is a vector.  It should not appear here.", varName.c_str() );
00234           throw SpkCompilerException( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_PROGRAMMER_ERR, m, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00235         }
00236       else
00237         {
00238           // The other vectors if there's any are irrelevant in this class
00239           // because they are computed outside of Pred.
00240           continue;
00241         }
00242     }
00243       else if( objType == Symbol::MATRIX )
00244     {
00245       if( varName == nonmem::OMEGA || varName == nonmem::SIGMA )
00246         {
00247           // These are irrelevant in this class.
00248           continue;
00249         }
00250       else
00251         {
00252           // There should be no matrices except the ones above.
00253           char m[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00254           snprintf( m, 
00255             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00256             "%s is a matrix.  It should not appear here.", varName.c_str() );
00257           throw SpkCompilerException( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_PROGRAMMER_ERR, m, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00258         }
00259     }
00260       else // SCALAR
00261     {
00262       oPred_h << "spk_ValueType " << varName << ";" << endl;
00263     }
00264     }
00265 
00266   oPred_h << "};" << endl;
00267   oPred_h << endl;
00268

00270   //
00271   // Definition of DataSet class
00272   //
00273   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

00280   oPred_h << ": spk_perm( dataIn )," << endl;
00281   oPred_h << "  spk_nIndividuals( " << getPopSize() << " )," << endl;
00282   oPred_h << "  spk_isIterCompleted( true )" << endl;
00283   oPred_h << "{" << endl;
00284   oPred_h << "}" << endl;
00285   oPred_h << endl;

00399   oPred_h << "{" << endl;
00400 
00401   oPred_h << "   assert( spk_thetaLen == " << myThetaLen << " );" << endl;
00402   oPred_h << "   assert( ( spk_etaLen == " << myEtaLen << " && spk_epsLen == " << myEpsLen   << " ) ||" << endl;
00403   oPred_h << "           ( spk_etaLen == " << myEpsLen << " && spk_epsLen == " << 0          << " ) );   // Allow these for two-stage methods." << endl;
00404   oPred_h << endl;
00405 
00407   // Assign the current data (i,j) to appropriate variables
00408   // so that the user's (originally-fortran) code can easily
00409   // access them.
00410   // ex.  cp = spk_perm->data[spk_i]->cp
00411   // ...given that the user's PRED code has a reference to something
00412   // ...like "aaa = cp * 10.0".
00413   //
00414   for( pLabel = labels->begin(); pLabel != labels->end(); pLabel++ )
00415     {
00416       const Symbol *s = table->find( *pLabel );
00417       // label
00418       oPred_h << "   " << s->name;
00419       oPred_h << " = spk_perm->data[spk_i]->";
00420       oPred_h << s->name << "[spk_j];" << endl;
00421       // synonym
00422       if( !s->synonym.empty() )
00423     {
00424       oPred_h << "   " << s->synonym;
00425       oPred_h << " = spk_perm->data[spk_i]->";
00426       oPred_h << s->synonym << "[spk_j];" << endl;
00427     }
00428     }
00429   oPred_h << "   " << nonmem::THETA;
00430   oPred_h << " = spk_indepVar.begin() + spk_thetaOffset;" << endl;
00431   for( int i=0; i<myThetaLen; i++ )
00432     {
00433       oPred_h << "   typename std::vector<spk_ValueType>::const_iterator " << nonmem::THETA << i+1;
00434       oPred_h << " = spk_indepVar.begin() + spk_thetaOffset + " << i << ";" << endl;
00435     }
00436 
00437   oPred_h << "   " << nonmem::ETA;
00438   oPred_h << " = spk_indepVar.begin() + spk_etaOffset;" << endl;
00439   for( int i=0; i<myEtaLen; i++ )
00440     {
00441       oPred_h << "   typename std::vector<spk_ValueType>::const_iterator " << nonmem::ETA << i+1;
00442       oPred_h << " = spk_indepVar.begin() + spk_etaOffset + " << i << ";" << endl;
00443     }
00444 
00445   // EPS is only apparent in the population analysis.
00446   // The size of EPS vector is the order of SIGMA which is only apparent in
00447   // the population analysis.  So, if this is the individual level,
00448   // "myEpsLen" has been set to zero; thus the following loop loops zero times.
00449   if( getTarget() == POP )
00450     {
00451       oPred_h << "   if ( spk_epsLen != 0 )" << endl;
00452       oPred_h << "   {" << endl;
00453       oPred_h << "      // Skip this if there are no eps values." << endl;
00454       oPred_h << "      " << nonmem::EPS;
00455       oPred_h << " = spk_indepVar.begin() + spk_epsOffset;" << endl;
00456       for( int i=0; i<myEpsLen; i++ )
00457     {
00458       oPred_h << "      typename std::vector<spk_ValueType>::const_iterator " << nonmem::EPS << i+1;
00459       oPred_h << " = spk_indepVar.begin() + spk_epsOffset + " << i << ";" << endl;
00460     }
00461       oPred_h << "   }" << endl;
00462     }
00463 
00464   //
00465   // Initializing Y and F.
00466   //
00467   // REVISIT Sachiko 08/25/2005
00468   // Do they need to be really initialized to zero here?
00469   // 
00470   //  oPred_h << "   spk_ValueType " << nonmem::F << " = 0.0;" << endl;
00471   //  oPred_h << "   spk_ValueType " << nonmem::Y << " = 0.0;" << endl;
00472   //
00474       
00475   oPred_h << "//=========================================" << endl;
00476   oPred_h << "// Begin User Code                         " << endl;
00477   oPred_h << "//-----------------------------------------" << endl;
00478   char ch;
00479   ifstream iPredEqn( fPredEqn_cpp );
00480   if( !iPredEqn.good() )
00481     {
00482       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00483       snprintf( mess, 
00484         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00485         "Failed to open %s file.", fPredEqn_cpp );
00486       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_STD_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00487       throw e;
00488     }
00489   while( iPredEqn.get(ch) )
00490     oPred_h.put(ch);
00491   iPredEqn.close();
00492   remove( fPredEqn_cpp );
00493   oPred_h << "//-----------------------------------------" << endl;
00494   oPred_h << "// End User Code                           " << endl;
00495   oPred_h << "//=========================================" << endl;
00496       
00498   // Store the current values in temporary storage
00499   // : the user defined variable values and the NONMEM required variable values.
00500   oPred_h << "   " << nonmem::PRED << " = " << nonmem::F << ";" << endl;
00501   oPred_h << "   " << nonmem::RES  << " = (" << nonmem::MDV << "==0? " << nonmem::DV << "-" << nonmem::PRED << " : 0 );" << endl;
00502 
00503   for( pT = t->begin(); pT != t->end(); pT++ )
00504     {
00505       // THETA, ETA, EPS are given OdePred::eval() as vectors by the caller.
00506       // So, we have to treat these guys a bit different from the user variables
00507       // which are scalar values.
00508       const string label                 = pT->second.name;
00509       enum Symbol::Ownership owner       = pT->second.owner;
00510       enum Symbol::ObjectType objectType = pT->second.object_type;
00511       enum Symbol::Access access         = pT->second.access;
00512 
00513       // Data items are constant, so we don't need to keep them.
00514       if( owner == Symbol::DATASET )
00515     continue;
00516 
00517       else if( owner == Symbol::SYSTEM )
00518         {
00519           if( objectType == Symbol::VECTOR )
00520             {
00521               if( label == nonmem::THETA )
00522             {
00523               oPred_h << "   copy( " << label << ", " << label << "+spk_thetaLen, ";
00524               oPred_h << "   spk_temp.data[ spk_i ]->" << label << "[ spk_j ].begin() ); " << endl;
00525                 }
00526               else if( label == nonmem::ETA )
00527             {
00528               oPred_h << "   copy( " << label << ", " << label << "+spk_etaLen, ";
00529               oPred_h << "   spk_temp.data[ spk_i ]->" << label << "[ spk_j ].begin() ); " << endl;
00530             }
00531               else if( label == nonmem::EPS )
00532             {
00533               oPred_h << "   if ( spk_epsLen != 0 )" << endl;
00534               oPred_h << "   {" << endl;
00535               oPred_h << "      // Skip this if there are no eps values." << endl;
00536               oPred_h << "      copy( " << label << ", " << label << "+spk_epsLen, ";
00537               oPred_h << "   spk_temp.data[ spk_i ]->" << label << "[ spk_j ].begin() ); " << endl;
00538               oPred_h << "   }" << endl;
00539             }
00540           else
00541         {}
00542         }
00543           else if( objectType == Symbol::MATRIX )
00544             {
00545               continue;
00546         }
00547           else // Scalar
00548         {
00549           if( label == nonmem::PRED || label == nonmem::RES || access == Symbol::READWRITE )
00550         {
00551           oPred_h << "   spk_temp.data[ spk_i ]->" << label << "[ spk_j ]";
00552           oPred_h << " = " << label << ";" << endl;
00553         }
00554         }
00555     }
00556       else // User
00557     {
00558       if( objectType == Symbol::SCALAR && access == Symbol::READWRITE )
00559         {
00560           oPred_h << "   spk_temp.data[ spk_i ]->" << label << "[ spk_j ]";
00561           oPred_h << " = " << label << ";" << endl;
00562         }    
00563     }
00564     }   
00565   oPred_h << endl;
00566 
00567   // Saving/moving computed values to ensure a complete set of values
00568   // is available even when a failure occurs.
00569   //
00570   oPred_h << "   if( spk_i == " << getPopSize() << "-1 && spk_j == spk_perm->data[spk_i]->";
00571   oPred_h << nonmem::ID << ".size()-1 )" << endl;
00572   oPred_h << "   {" << endl;
00573   oPred_h << "     // This means, SPK advanced in iteration." << endl;
00574   oPred_h << "     // Move temporary storage to spk_permanent storage." << endl;
00575   oPred_h << "     spk_isIterCompleted = true;" << endl;
00576   oPred_h << "     for( int i=0; i < spk_nIndividuals; i++ )" << endl;
00577   oPred_h << "     {" << endl;
00578 
00579   // Move spk_temp(current) => spk_permanent for all user defined variables and THETA/ETA/EPS vectors.
00580   for( pT = t->begin(); pT != t->end(); pT++ )
00581     {
00582       const string label                 = pT->second.name;
00583       enum Symbol::Ownership  owner      = pT->second.owner;
00584       enum Symbol::ObjectType objectType = pT->second.object_type;
00585       enum Symbol::Access access         = pT->second.access;
00586       if( owner == Symbol::DATASET )
00587         continue;
00588       else if( owner == Symbol::SYSTEM )
00589         {
00590       if( objectType == Symbol::MATRIX )
00591         continue;
00592       else if( objectType == Symbol::VECTOR )
00593         {
00594           if( label == nonmem::THETA 
00595           || label == nonmem::ETA )
00596         {
00597           oPred_h << "         spk_perm->data[ i ]->" << label;
00598           oPred_h << " = spk_temp.data[ i ]->";
00599           oPred_h << label << ";" << endl;
00600         }
00601           else if( label == nonmem::EPS )
00602         {
00603               oPred_h << "         if ( spk_epsLen != 0 )" << endl;
00604               oPred_h << "         {" << endl;
00605               oPred_h << "            // Skip this if there are no eps values." << endl;
00606           oPred_h << "            spk_perm->data[ i ]->" << label;
00607           oPred_h << " = spk_temp.data[ i ]->";
00608           oPred_h << label << ";" << endl;
00609               oPred_h << "         }" << endl;
00610         }
00611         }
00612           else if( objectType == Symbol::MATRIX )
00613             {
00614               continue;
00615         }
00616           else // Scalar
00617         {
00618           if( label == nonmem::PRED || label == nonmem::RES || access == Symbol::READWRITE )
00619         {
00620           oPred_h << "         spk_perm->data[ i ]->" << label;
00621           oPred_h << " = spk_temp.data[ i ]->" << label << ";" << endl;
00622         }
00623         }
00624         }
00625       else // User
00626         { 
00627       if( objectType == Symbol::SCALAR && access == Symbol::READWRITE )
00628         {
00629           oPred_h << "         spk_perm->data[ i ]->" << label;
00630           oPred_h << " = spk_temp.data[ i ]->";
00631           oPred_h << label << ";" << endl;
00632         }
00633         }
00634     }      
00635   oPred_h << "      }" << endl;
00636   oPred_h << "   }" << endl;
00637   oPred_h << "   else" << endl;
00638   oPred_h << "   {" << endl;
00639   oPred_h << "      spk_isIterCompleted = false;" << endl;
00640   oPred_h << "   }" << endl;
00641   oPred_h << endl;
00642 
00644 
00645   oPred_h << "   if( spk_perm->data[ spk_i ]->" << nonmem::MDV << "[ spk_j ] == 0 )" << endl;
00646   oPred_h << "   {" << endl;
00647   oPred_h << "      spk_m = getMeasurementIndex( spk_i, spk_j );" << endl;
00648   oPred_h << "      spk_depVar[ spk_fOffset+spk_m ] = " << nonmem::F << ";" << endl;
00649   oPred_h << "      spk_depVar[ spk_yOffset+spk_m ] = " << nonmem::Y << ";" << endl;
00650   oPred_h << "      return true;" << endl;
00651   oPred_h << "   }" << endl;
00652   oPred_h << "   else" << endl;
00653   oPred_h << "      return false;" << endl;
00654   oPred_h << "}" << endl;
00655 
00656   oPred_h << "template <class spk_ValueType>" << endl;
00657   oPred_h << "Pred<spk_ValueType>::Pred()" << endl;
00658   oPred_h << "{" << endl;
00659   oPred_h << "}" << endl;
00660 
00661   oPred_h << "template <class spk_ValueType>" << endl;
00662   oPred_h << "Pred<spk_ValueType>::Pred( const Pred<spk_ValueType>& )" << endl;
00663   oPred_h << "{" << endl;
00664   oPred_h << "}" << endl;
00665 
00666   oPred_h << "template <class spk_ValueType>" << endl;
00667   oPred_h << "Pred<spk_ValueType> & Pred<spk_ValueType>::operator=( const Pred<spk_ValueType>& )" << endl;
00668   oPred_h << "{" << endl;
00669   oPred_h << "}" << endl;
00670 
00671   oPred_h << "#endif" << endl;
00672   oPred_h.close();
00673 }
